text: Oleg Pavlovich Tabakov (; 17 August 1935 – 12 March 2018) was a Soviet and Russian actor and the artistic director of the Moscow Art Theatre. He was born in Saratov. Tabakov acted in Anatoly Efros' A Noisy Day (1960), Grigori Chukhrai's Clear Skies (1961), Sergei Bondarchuk's War and Peace (1966–67), TV series Seventeen Instants of Spring (1973) and D'Artagnan and Three Musketeers (1978), the Academy Award-winning Moscow Does Not Believe In Tears (1980), Nikita Mikhalkov's Oblomov (1981) and Dark Eyes (1986), and A Man from the Boulevard des Capuchines (1987). Tabakov died at a Moscow hospital on 12 March 2018 at the age of 82. ==References== ==Other websites== * *Tabakov Theatre in Moscow *Tabakov's webpage on the website of the Moscow Art Theatre *Complete filmography Category:1935 births Category:2018 deaths Category:Soviet actors Category:Russian movie actors Category:Russian television actors Category:Russian stage actors Category:Actors from Moscow
title: Oleg Tabakov
